intro: Lepidium montanum subsp. alpinum, commonly known as the alpine cress, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Alps and other mountainous areas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cold, moist environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a slightly peppery taste, while its seeds are small and capsule-like. Lepidium montanum subsp. alpinum is an important part of alpine ecosystems, providing food for various insects and contributing to soil stabilization.
